decks.notes: The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to maintain control of the game by using a combination of disruption, removal, and card advantage. It focuses on using bounce effects and counterspells to keep the opponent's threats at bay, while also utilizing cheap removal spells like Snuff Out and Cast Down to deal with any threats that do hit the board. The deck also includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Preordain to help find answers and maintain a steady flow of resources. Additionally, it includes a Ninja of the Deep Hours package for additional card advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck focuses on using cards like Kor Skyfisher, Glint Hawk, and Thraben Inspector to establish an early board presence and maintain card advantage. Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast provide direct damage to remove threats and finish off the opponent. The deck also utilizes artifact lands like Great Furnace and Ancient Den to fuel spells like Barbed Batterfist and Foundry Helix. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining a steady stream of threats and constantly applying pressure.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy by using low-cost, evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent. It aims to control the opponent's board by utilizing counterspells like Counterspell and Force Spike, as well as bounce spells like Boomerang. The deck utilizes card draw spells like Thought Scour and Deep Analysis to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Tolarian Terror and LÃ³rien Revealed offers additional control and disruption options. By combining tempo play and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and quickly finish the game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, cheap creatures. It focuses on playing multiple creatures per turn and generating card advantage with cards like Squadron Hawk and Thraben Inspector. The deck also utilizes powerful combat tricks like Prismatic Strands and Guardians' Pledge to protect its creatures and deal damage. The inclusion of Journey to Nowhere provides removal for problematic enemy creatures. The deck aims to maintain a steady flow of creatures and control the board through a combination of card draw and efficient creatures.

The main concept of this Golgari Garden control deck is to use a combination of removal spells, token generation, and card draw to control the game and outlast the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Spinning Darkness, Echoing Decay, Snuff Out, and Chainer's Edict to deal with the opponent's threats. Khalni Garden and Ichor Wellspring provide token creatures and additional card advantage. Llanowar Visionary and Avenging Hunter offer additional card draw. The deck also includes a mix of powerful removal spells like Cast Down and Crypt Rats to handle a variety of threats.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. The deck includes a mix of cheap counterspells like Dispel and Spell Pierce, along with removal spells like Skred and Lightning Bolt. It also features card draw spells like Preordain and Brainstorm to ensure consistent resources. The deck utilizes creatures like Augur of Bolas and Murmuring Mystic to generate additional value and maintain board presence. Overall, the strategy of this deck revolves around maintaining control and outlasting the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and efficient damage. It focuses on using low-cost burn spells like Chain Lightning, Searing Blaze, and Lightning Bolt to deal damage to the opponent's creatures and directly to their life total. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Thermo-Alchemist and Monastery Swiftspear to continue applying pressure. Additionally, it includes card-draw effects like Reckless Impulse and Experimental Synthesizer to maintain a steady flow of resources. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly by relentlessly attacking and burning the opponent's life total.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck utilizes fast mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Kuldotha Rebirth to quickly flood the board with creatures. It also includes burn spells like Chain Lightning and Lightning Bolt to deal direct damage to the opponent and their creatures. The deck aims to maintain a high tempo and pressure the opponent early on, utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Bushwhacker to quickly finish off the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost artifacts to quickly flood the board and take advantage of the affinity mechanic. By using cards like Frogmite, Ornithopter, and Myr Enforcer, the deck can quickly deploy threats and overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtcast and Of One Mind allow the deck to draw additional cards to maintain its aggressive strategy. Cards like All That Glitters and Moon-Circuit Hacker enhance the power and toughness of creatures, making them even more threatening. The deck also includes countermagic in the form of Metallic Rebuke to disrupt opponent's strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's plays and disrupt their game plan using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. The deck aims to continuously generate card advantage through creatures like Augur of Bolas and Ninja of the Deep Hours, while utilizing Spellstutter Sprite to counter opponent's spells. It also includes a mix of removal spells like Snuff Out and Devour Flesh to deal with threats, and board control tools like Bojuka Bog. The deck's mana base focuses on a combination of Islands and Swamps with supporting lands like Contaminated Aquifer.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the flickering mechanic to generate repetitive value and advantage. By repeatedly flickering creatures like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer, the deck can draw extra cards, replay spells from the graveyard, and control the board state. The deck also includes a selection of control spells like Snap and Prohibit to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Sunscape Familiar and God-Pharaoh's Faithful provide additional defensive capabilities and help to lower the overall mana cost of the deck.
